skill.name: multi-cloud-architecture
skill.description: Design multi-cloud architectures using a decision framework to select and integrate services across AWS, Azure, and GCP. Use when building multi-cloud systems, avoiding vendor lock-in, or leveraging best-of-breed services from multiple providers.
skill.summary: Design multi-cloud architectures using a decision framework to select and integrate services across ...
skill.author: wshobson

security_audit.summary: This skill is documentation only and contains no executable code, scripts, or network behavior. No data access or external command usage was found.

content.user_title: Design a multi cloud architecture plan
content.value_statement: Selecting services across clouds is complex and slow. This skill provides a decision framework, comparisons, and patterns to guide architecture choices.
actual_capabilities: Compare compute, storage, and database services across AWS, Azure, and GCP
Recommend multi cloud patterns for DR, best of breed, and geographic distribution
Outline cloud agnostic architecture layers and tool choices like Kubernetes and Terraform
Provide a phased migration strategy from assessment to optimization
List cost optimization factors and tactics across providers
limitations: Does not deploy infrastructure or run cloud commands
Does not provide real time pricing or region availability
Does not include the referenced comparison and pattern files
Does not perform security or compliance audits

use_cases.title: Map services across clouds
use_cases.description: Compare AWS, Azure, and GCP services and select the best fit for each workload.

use_cases.title: Plan a migration roadmap
use_cases.description: Create phased steps, risks, and validation checks for multi cloud migration.

use_cases.title: Review cost levers
use_cases.description: Identify pricing factors and optimization tactics by provider.

prompt_templates.title: Service mapping
prompt_templates.scenario: Map an AWS stack to other clouds
prompt_templates.prompt: Map EC2, RDS, and S3 to Azure and GCP equivalents and note key differences.

prompt_templates.title: Pattern selection
prompt_templates.prompt: Recommend a multi cloud pattern for high availability and explain the tradeoffs.

prompt_templates.title: Migration plan
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a four phase migration plan from Azure to a multi cloud setup with key tasks.

prompt_templates.title: Best of breed stack
prompt_templates.prompt: Propose a best of breed architecture for AI workloads, identity, and compute across AWS, Azure, and GCP.

output_examples.input: Design a multi cloud architecture for a global SaaS product
output: Pattern: Geographic distribution with regional failover
Compute: Kubernetes across EKS, AKS, and GKE
Data: PostgreSQL with cross region replication
Storage: S3 compatible object storage with lifecycle policies
Ops: Centralized monitoring with Prometheus and Grafana

best_practices: Define selection criteria before comparing services
Use infrastructure as code to keep environments consistent
Test disaster recovery regularly across clouds
anti_patterns: Mixing providers without a shared monitoring plan
Skipping analysis of cross cloud data transfer costs

faq.question: Which platforms support this skill?
faq.answer: It works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code.

faq.question: Does it provide exact pricing?
faq.answer: No, it explains pricing factors but does not fetch live prices.

faq.question: Can it integrate with Terraform or CI tools?
faq.answer: It suggests patterns but does not run tools or generate code.

faq.question: Does it access my files or credentials?
faq.answer: No, it is static guidance and reads no local data.

faq.question: What if service mapping is unclear?
faq.answer: Provide workload details and desired features for a closer match.

faq.question: How does it compare to vendor guides?
faq.answer: It compares providers and focuses on portability across clouds.
